Description: Cylinder jar of dull red pottery: with a smooth cream-grey slip. The vase narrows slightly from the base to the neck, where there is an incised line of decoration. Just below this line is a single hieroglyph incised on the surface of the clay before application of the slip. The rim is of the usual external roll type. Restored from fragments.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 157 (distribution list, cem. 11700) and pl. XXXVIII, 35.
